author: Slobrojoe
title: I donâ€™t really appreciate Lego friends...
review:
Ok, just so you know, I'm a boy. I really don't appreciate the LEGO Friends line because.... I don't. I bought this set in the reduced area of Asda (UK version of Walmart) and I like to review every set I build. So, keep that in mind and sorry in advance if I don't understand much about Friends (I stick to Star Wars and Ninjago). This is the first ever Friends set I have got/bought.

Box/Instructions

As I said, this was in the reduced area so the box was a little bit battered. It's approximately the size of a Star Wars Battle Pack box. The instructions were folded (grrr) making it a little bit hard to read. Also, the bags were all non-recyclable.

Minifigs

The set has Stephanie (?) and a puppy. Stephanie has a bow in her hair and a one-side printed torso. The puppy also can hold a bow in its head hair.

Build

In my opinion, this build is quite bizarre. The bed is nice but has a sticker. A poster on the wall also has a sticker along with a dialogue clock. A gold trophy is nice but who has a golf course in their room? The puppy also has a kennel but why would it be in her bedroom? A printed phone is on a stand and the golf course can swivel round. It took approximately 15 minutes to build, with no difficulty.

Parts

The gold trophy is nice and the baby blue hairbrush and phone are cool. It includes a window and an awesome water bottle. It also has a draw. The colours are the usual spectrum of purple, yellow, baby blue and baby pink, and white.

Price

The price I got it for was £1.60 ($2.09). Any set with this price is just dying to be bought, so I got the last 2.

Pros:

-Nice parts

-Cool dog

Cons:

-Golf course in a bedroom

-Kennel in a bedroom

-Stickers (don't know if Friends fans appreciate stickers but Star Wars definitely don't!)

Overall, to a boy Star Wars fan, there is nothing spectacularly eye catching but the price I got it for. Thanks for reading and check out my Star Wars reviews.
